Chef Mike Gets it Right
reviews.text: Ryan, our server, was very friendly and his knowledge of the menu was extensive. Geno, the manager, also made sure to take great care of us with Kimpton hospitality. In fact, the entire staff (esp. Patrick, Shina, & Gabrielle- Thanks!) was extremely welcoming and accommodating.

reviews.title: swanky!
reviews.text: As for the food, the pork belly appetizer was all of our favorites--divine. The shrimp guacamole was great (we split many appetizers, instead of ordering entrees). For dessert we ordered the "Dirt Cup" which was out of this world! The drinks are also original and delicious (Ahmed is the BEST bartender around). The mango fizz was a favorite.

I'm a Miami native, and this trendy new place gives you not only great food (the seafood is really good, and the recipes creative) but most of all, their big terrace gives you a super spectacular view of "The New Miami." It's all because this place is at the top of Miami's chic new Epic Hotel--you'll enjoy the lobby, too, with water flowing through fountain "rivers," etc, and of course everywhere is the multicolored soft neon-colored lighting Miami is now famous far. Anyhow, go up the fancy elevator to Area 31 at the top, and walk directly out onto the terrace. It would be a crime to sit "inside" at this place. The fortunate thing for Area 31 is its building's particular position. Yes, it's on the Miami River, with a view of Biscayne Bay, which is all beautiful, but it's even better than that, because of a little twist in the major road below, it sits in the center and at the very head of one of the most beautiful avenues of modern skyscrapers in the world. The Epic is built at the very north end of Miami's Brickell Avenue, the Magic City's famous and very expensive financial district which boasts magnificent modern buildings built by and for banks from all around the world. You can sit and sip your drink, or eat your shrimp appetizer while gazing down a couple of miles of some of the most spectacular office towers anywhere...they're almost all international award winners. The view is breathtaking during the day, but it's twice as spectacular at night, when all the buildings light up with their innovative multicolored light designs from top to bottom. By the way, what does "Area 31 mean?" Well, that's the number of the Caribbean area on nautical charts, and since the seafood is from that area...that's the idea. This is the perfect sophisticated place for a first or last night in Miami, and guaranteed to impress anyone on a balmy tropical evening. It's really beautiful, not touristy, and very enjoyable just to be there. None of the craziness of South Beach, but all the glamor. Enjoy!
reviews.title: The best restaurant view in Miami, great food too.
confused restaurant lacking the "wow" element
reviews.text: We went to this restaurant to try the Amazonian Paiche fish as it is currently served at three South Florida location but Area 31 was the only one that had it on the current menu. The fish was good although I honestly didn't see what the big deal is about as I would not place it on the same footing as Chilean Sea Bass, to give one example.

reviews.title: Great to visit but not to be above
reviews.text: The service was excellent. The menu was rather limited, no soups. We decided to try some appetizers and ordered the Pork Belly and the Foie Gras. They were good but nowhere "excellent" in fact one ingredient in the Pork Belly appetizer (the duck skin) was rancid and to give the restaurant credit they were apologetic about it and removed the item from the bill and dessert was on the house.

reviews.title: Foot good and very creative
reviews.text: Now the main dish was not what I expected. I read about the Paiche fish and believe that the dish could have been better as there was nothing "wow" about it. The fish was good, it didn't taste fishy and it was moist almost reminded me of Kobe Beef in that it melts in your mouth but there was something missing, I just think that the fish could be served in an entirely different manner. We chose the Coconut Rice to accompany the fish and the rice was too mushy, again not what I expected.
Dessert was also good, we chose one banana-based dessert and other named along the lines of "Dirt Dish". Again, they were good but still there no "wow" element.
reviews.title: Food you can play with
Hotel Restaurant/Bar
reviews.text: Solid restaurant/bar combo located inside Epic Hotel. Had lunch there twice and food was reasonably price and freshly prepared. Servers were hospitable but was slight delay on 1130AM opening (15 min) due to staff meeting. Bar with television at front and loooong happy hour (10PM) on Friday, so place was jumping.

reviews.title: yumm-o!
reviews.text: We had an excellent time at area 31. I suggest making reservation outside. The ambiance was fun and there was also a DJ. I suggest trying the Bone Marrow, Tuna and the Hanger Steak!

reviews.title: beautiful interior design, great appetizers
reviews.text: Great place to go for a drink, sunset and appetizers. Save your money on the meal. Just go for drinks and food before you go out somewhere less expensive...

reviews.title: Good Restaurant and the food is excellent
reviews.text: The food is fresh, and the service is amazing. We went for drink and something light and stayed for dinner, is was very good. The restaurant is good and no to noise.

reviews.title: Good for lunch
reviews.text: We had lunch and the food was better than expected given some of the other reviews. The Mahi Mahi sandwich was very good, very moist and flavorful. In fact I have to say it was one of the better prepared pieces of fish I've had lately. It wasn't overcooked. Also ordered was the flatbread and pesto chicken sandwich, both equally good.

reviews.title: Excellent choice in Miami
reviews.text: Stayed at the Epic. Different mixture of ingredients in all dishes, but very good!

Make a reservation to sit outside. Only parking is valet, which is $13 once you get it stamped by your server. I had the Yellowtail Snapper and it was delish! Also, their desserts are amazing. The portions are small, so keep that in mind. This isn't a place you would want to order only 1 dish and share.
